https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases.content:
Led by industry veterans with extensive expertise in financial institution risk management technology, Empyrean has grown rapidly, tripling revenue over the past three years while operating profitably, as leading banks and credit unions have increasingly adopted Empyrean software solutions. "We designed Empyrean to help finance leaders effectively manage balance sheet risks and meet regulatory requirements. As the needs of our customers have evolved, Empyrean has expanded its platform capabilities right alongside them," said Chris Maclin, CEO of Empyrean. "Our new partnership with Spectrum Equity will further our commitment to provide best-in-class risk and balance sheet management solutions and accelerate our investment in product offerings that meet the evolving business and planning [...] Empyrean's software allows banks and credit unions of all sizes to take control of their balance sheet management, scenario planning, and risk analysis in a single software platform. The company offers a host of modules, including asset and liability management, liquidity stress testing, deposit analytics, budgeting, and profitability to provide a centralized view of an institution's financial strength for the broader office of the CFO and key business stakeholders. [...] About Information VP  
Information Venture Partners is a Toronto-based team of experienced venture capital investors focused on backing the next generation of leaders in B2B FinTech and Enterprise SaaS. Current investments include BigID, Cinchy, Coconut Software, Flybits, Jirav, Knowtions, LendingFront, PostBeyond, Procurify, Q4, Sensibill, Arteria.ai, and Thoughtexchange. For more information, please visit www.informationvp.com.

https://www.epam.com/about/newsroom/pres.content: *Combining Cursor’s AI-native IDE with EPAM’s AI/Run™ delivery, the partnership moves enterprises beyond AI coding pilots and delivers measurable gains in productivity, sustainable quality and an enhanced developer experience for thousands of engineers.*. **Newtown, PA, USA, January** **8, 2026 -** **EPAM Systems, Inc.** **(NYSE: EPAM)**, a leading digital and AI transformation services company, today announced a strategic partnership with Cursor, a leading AI-powered development platform, to accelerate enterprise adoption of generative AI engineering for clients. By combining EPAM’s proven expertise in large-scale technology implementation with Cursor’s demonstrated success in AI-Native coding solutions, the partnership enables organizations to adopt AI-Native workflows that streamline engineering, reduce time-to-value and deliver measurable business outcomes. Combined with EPAM’s 50,000+ engineering professionals globally, team-level maturity models, reference rulesets, curated context, training and productivity measurement, this partnership provides a comprehensive solution to accelerate clients' transformation into AI-Native technology organizations.

https://www.accountingtoday.com/news/hal.content: Accounting software company Halfpricesoft unveiled its ez1099 2025 solution for the preparation, printing and e-filing of essential IRS forms for businesses and tax professionals. The solution offers e-filing capacities for Forms W2, 1099 and 1099-DA for digital assets. "With ez1099 2025 and the new e-file add-on, businesses of every size can now handle 1099 reporting faster, easier and with total confidence," said Mark Ge, founder of Halfpricesoft.com, in a statement. The announcement comes shortly after the company launched a network edition that allows ACA forms to be filed with the IRS from multiple locations as well as an e-file service to clients who do not have an IRS account and TCC. With this option, the client purchases both an ez1095 license and e-filing service fee. https://www.motor1.com/news/783249/audi-.content: In a video with more than 4,500 views, an Audi mechanic (@mercsways) shared his disbelief after discovering just how long a recall update would take to complete. The recall in question appears to be for Audi's 90 VT system, and the software update required to complete it takes a staggering 2.5 hours to download and install. While manufacturers like Tesla can push over-the-air updates remotely, most software recalls still require a visit to the dealership. Recent state laws in New Jersey and Virginia have attempted to address this by requiring manufacturers to pay dealerships no less than retail labor rates for warranty and recall work, but the fundamental problem remains: when software downloads take hours longer than estimated, someone loses money. Other recent Audi software recalls include camera control unit errors affecting 2024-2025 Q3 vehicles, brake control unit software issues, headlight control module problems, and electric vehicle charging system malfunctions—all requiring dealership visits for software updates. Other mechanics shared their own frustrations with software recalls in comments on the post.

https://www.securityweek.com/from-open-s.content: From open source libraries to AI-powered coding assistants, speed-driven development is introducing new third-party risks that threat actors are increasingly exploiting. From open source software libraries to AI-enabled coding assistants, these tools enable rapid innovations, but they are also enabling attack vectors that threat actors are looking to exploit.**. The Log4J vulnerability, Log4Shell, demonstrated how third-party risk can manifest in open source software libraries, which have been widely adopted and implemented into enterprise services. Lately, threat actors have turned their attention to AI-enabled coding assistants and their tendency to hallucinate factually incorrect responses; in this example, a software library that does not exist. The complexity of software dependencies throughout the supply chain can make it difficult to monitor for vulnerabilities and risks. When it comes to AI-enabled coding assistants, developers need to be aware of their risks, such as poor account authentication and input validation weaknesses. # Top 10 ERP Software Vendors, Market Size and Forecast 2024-2029

Worldwide ERP Applications Market to reach $179.8 billion by 2029, compared with $135.9 billion in 2024 at a compound annual growth rate of 5.7%.

By Albert Pang, Misho Markovski and Marija Ristik

In 2024, the global ERP software market grew to $135.9 billion, marking a 9.4% year-over-year increase. The top 10 vendors accounted for 26.5% of the total market. Oracle led the pack with a 6.5% market share, followed by SAP, Intuit, Constellation Software, and Microsoft.
https://www.appsruntheworld.com/top-10-e.raw_content:
Q2. Who are the top 10 ERP software vendors in 2024 and their combined share?  
 A: The top 10 ERP vendors are Oracle, SAP, Intuit, Constellation Software, Microsoft, FIS Global, IQVIA, Roper Technologies, Sage, and Infor, together capturing 26.5% of the worldwide market.

Q3. Which vendor leads the ERP software market in 2024?  
 A: Oracle leads the global ERP market in 2024 with a 6.5% share, powered by Oracle Fusion Cloud ERP, NetSuite ERP, and its Cerner-driven healthcare expansion.

Q4. How does this report define the ERP market scope?  
 A: The ERP market covers financial management (AP/AR, GL, assets, invoicing, payments, reporting), operations management (back-office, order, customer info), plus EHS, GRC, and industry-specific ERP applications. Led by industry veterans with extensive expertise in financial institution risk management technology, Empyrean has grown rapidly, tripling revenue over the past three years while operating profitably, as leading banks and credit unions have increasingly adopted Empyrean software solutions. "We designed Empyrean to help finance leaders effectively manage balance sheet risks and meet regulatory requirements. As the needs of our customers have evolved, Empyrean has expanded its platform capabilities right alongside them," said Chris Maclin, CEO of Empyrean. "Our new partnership with Spectrum Equity will further our commitment to provide best-in-class risk and balance sheet management solutions and accelerate our investment in product offerings that meet the evolving business and planning [...] Empyrean's software allows banks and credit unions of all sizes to take control of their balance sheet management, scenario planning, and risk analysis in a single software platform. The company offers a host of modules, including asset and liability management, liquidity stress testing, deposit analytics, budgeting, and profitability to provide a centralized view of an institution's financial strength for the broader office of the CFO and key business stakeholders. [...] About Information VP  
Information Venture Partners is a Toronto-based team of experienced venture capital investors focused on backing the next generation of leaders in B2B FinTech and Enterprise SaaS. Current investments include BigID, Cinchy, Coconut Software, Flybits, Jirav, Knowtions, LendingFront, PostBeyond, Procurify, Q4, Sensibill, Arteria.ai, and Thoughtexchange. For more information, please visit www.informationvp.com.

Empyrean Solutions™ is a leading provider of risk and performance management solutions for banks and credit unions. Empyrean’s software allows financial institutions of all sizes to take control of their balance sheet management, scenario planning, and risk/performance analysis in a single integrated software platform. Through their deployed software and outsource services, Empyrean works with banks and credit unions, ranging from $50 million to $200+ billion in assets.

https://www.motor1.com/news/783249/audi-.content: In a video with more than 4,500 views, an Audi mechanic (@mercsways) shared his disbelief after discovering just how long a recall update would take to complete. The recall in question appears to be for Audi's 90 VT system, and the software update required to complete it takes a staggering 2.5 hours to download and install. While manufacturers like Tesla can push over-the-air updates remotely, most software recalls still require a visit to the dealership. Recent state laws in New Jersey and Virginia have attempted to address this by requiring manufacturers to pay dealerships no less than retail labor rates for warranty and recall work, but the fundamental problem remains: when software downloads take hours longer than estimated, someone loses money. Other recent Audi software recalls include camera control unit errors affecting 2024-2025 Q3 vehicles, brake control unit software issues, headlight control module problems, and electric vehicle charging system malfunctions—all requiring dealership visits for software updates. Other mechanics shared their own frustrations with software recalls in comments on the post.

https://www.securityweek.com/from-open-s.content: From open source libraries to AI-powered coding assistants, speed-driven development is introducing new third-party risks that threat actors are increasingly exploiting. From open source software libraries to AI-enabled coding assistants, these tools enable rapid innovations, but they are also enabling attack vectors that threat actors are looking to exploit.**. The Log4J vulnerability, Log4Shell, demonstrated how third-party risk can manifest in open source software libraries, which have been widely adopted and implemented into enterprise services. Lately, threat actors have turned their attention to AI-enabled coding assistants and their tendency to hallucinate factually incorrect responses; in this example, a software library that does not exist. The complexity of software dependencies throughout the supply chain can make it difficult to monitor for vulnerabilities and risks. When it comes to AI-enabled coding assistants, developers need to be aware of their risks, such as poor account authentication and input validation weaknesses. Subscribe to the SecurityWeek Email Briefing to stay informed on the latest cybersecurity news, threats, and expert insights.

The Log4J vulnerability, Log4Shell, demonstrated how third-party risk can manifest in open source software libraries, which have been widely adopted and implemented into enterprise services. Lately, threat actors have turned their attention to AI-enabled coding assistants and their tendency to hallucinate factually incorrect responses; in this example, a software library that does not exist. The complexity of software dependencies throughout the supply chain can make it difficult to monitor for vulnerabilities and risks. When it comes to AI-enabled coding assistants, developers need to be aware of their risks, such as poor account authentication and input validation weaknesses. Subscribe to the SecurityWeek Email Briefing to stay informed on the latest cybersecurity news, threats, and expert insights.

## Why Choose Empyra as Your Jira Align Implementation Partner?

tech

### Certified Jira Align Experts

Our team is trained and certified to deliver seamless Jira Align implementations tailored to your business.

tech

### Business-First Approach [...] Jira Align is designed for large enterprises practicing agile at scale. It supports roles from team leads to executives who need visibility into work progress and strategic alignment. 

Jira Align seamlessly integrates with Jira Software and other Atlassian products like Confluence, allowing teams to sync real-time work data with strategic plans. 

Jira Align pricing is customized based on organization size, user count, and deployment needs. Contact Empyra for a tailored quote and consultation. 

Getting started begins with an assessment of your current agile maturity. Empyra provides consulting, implementation, training, and support to ensure a smooth rollout. [...] ## Our Approach for Jira Align

At Empyra, we take a strategic, phased approach to ensure Jira Align drives measurable results across your enterprise. Our process bridges the gap between business goals and agile execution through expert guidance and hands-on support. 

We assess your teams, tools, and goals to plan the right Jira Align strategy.

Configure Jira Align to fit your processes, frameworks, and tool ecosystem.

Support go-live with onboarding, team enablement, and initial agile program rollout.

Monitor progress with built-in reporting, dashboards, and real-time visibility.

Continuously refine workflows and align teams based on data and feedback.

Get ongoing help, updates, and agile coaching for long-term success.

values.industry_briefing:
### Market Overview
* Empyra software solution's exact market segment is case management and IT consulting for state and local government, higher education, and adult education.
* The project management software market is expected to reach USD 15.06 billion by 2032.
* The project management software market is growing at a CAGR of 18.48% from 2024 to 2032.

### Direct Competition
* Named direct competitors include Atlassian, Microsoft, SAP, and Salesforce.
* Specific competing products include monday.com and Atlassian's suite of tools.
* Market positions include being a Gold Partner for monday.com and a Platinum Enterprise partner for Atlassian.

### Competitive Advantages
* Unique technical features include a highly configurable case management platform with a low-code/no-code approach.
* Proven advantages include strategic consulting services and partnerships with major tech companies like Microsoft and SAP.

### Market Challenges
* Specific verified challenges include adapting to the evolving demands of remote work and hybrid teams, requiring automation and smarter collaboration.
values.company_briefing:
Empyra software solution is a full-service software products and services company that provides innovative software solutions and consulting services for businesses in both the private and public sectors.

### Core Product/Service
* Highly configurable Case Management Platform for state and local government, higher education, and adult education.
* Low-code/no-code platform for easy implementation and configurability.
* Consulting services for strategic and technical advisory, agility coaching, DevOps, and ITSM.
* CSV User Importer for Jira for bulk user import and field mapping.
* Seamless Jira–ServiceNow sync for ITSM and DevOps collaboration.
* Agile Portfolio Management aligning OKRs with Jira and Confluence.
* Monday.com consulting services for enterprise project management.

### Leadership Team
* Shanthi Subramanyam - Founder & CEO, expertise in computing and information systems.
* Vishy Subramanyam - Founder & CTO, expertise in enterprise software and technical strategy.
* Trevor Aulick - Vice President, Sales.
* Karthikh - Head of Professional Services.
* Ed Stocking - Chief Technical Architect.
* Manjula Krishna - Managing Director, India.
* Nishad Parakkal - Director, Human Resources.
* Eli Alexander - Head of Customer Success.

### Target Market
* State and local government.
* Higher education and adult education sectors.
* Medium and large organizations in various industries.
* Enterprises practicing agile at scale.
* Confirmed partners include Atlassian, Monday.com, Microsoft, SAP, and Salesforce.

### Key Differentiators
* Over 30 years of experience in software products and services.
* Atlassian Platinum Enterprise partner and Monday.com Partner.
* Proven expertise in agility coaching, technical advisory, and IT consulting.
* Pre-configured solutions for rapid implementation.
* Business-first approach to Jira Align implementation.

### Business Model
* Customized pricing for Jira Align based on organization size, user count, and deployment needs.
* Distribution through partnerships with Atlassian, Monday.com, Microsoft, SAP, and Salesforce.
* Consulting, implementation, training, and support services for seamless transformation.

### 3. Average Revenue Per Client

This measures the average revenue generated from each client, providing insights into the profitability of your customer base. It's an essential metric for evaluating the health of your client relationships and the effectiveness of your fee models.

Formula: Average Revenue per Client = Total Revenue / Total Number of Clients

### 4. Time Spent On Each Client

This metric measures the amount of time spent managing each client, helping assess resource usage when compared to net profits for each client. It's crucial for optimizing your practice management and ensuring you're allocating time effectively.

### 5. Net Profit Per Client [...] ### 2. Customer Lifetime Value (LTV)

This represents the total expected revenue from a single customer, influenced by your fee structure and AUM minimums. It's a crucial metric for understanding the long-term value of your client relationships.

Formula: LTV = Average Purchase Value × Purchase Frequency × Customer Lifespan

### 3. Marketing Conversion Rate

This percentage shows how many visitors are performing a desired action (e.g., subscribing, scheduling a call). This rate should be tracked across various marketing initiatives to understand which are most effective.

Formula: Conversion Rate = (Number of Conversions / Total Number of Visitors) × 100

### 4. Website Traffic [...] ### 3. Amount Of Recurring Revenue

This represents the total amount of revenue generated from ongoing client relationships. The higher this figure, the better your client and revenue retention. It's a key indicator of the stability and predictability of your practice's income.

### 4. Next-Generation Client Relationship Rate

This percentage shows how many of your clients' next generation (e.g., children or heirs) are also engaged with your firm. It indicates your ability to sustain relationships across generations, which is crucial for long-term practice growth.

Formula: Next-Generation Client Relationship Rate = (Number of Clients with Next-Generation Engagement / Total Number of Clients) × 100

23.   ### Return on Assets (ROA)

This efficiency metric shows how well an operations management team uses its assets to generate profit. It takes into account all assets, including current assets such as accounts receivable and inventory, as well as fixed assets, such as equipment and real estate. ROA excludes interest expense, as financing decisions are typically not within operating managers’ control. The formula for return on assets is:

Return on assets = Net income / Total assets for period

24.   ### Selling, General and Administrative (SG&A) Ratio [...] 1.   ### Gross Profit Margin

This is an intermediate — but critical — measure of the profitability and efficiency of the company’s core business. It’s calculated as gross profit divided by net sales, and is usually expressed as a percentage. Gross profit is net sales minus cost of goods sold (COGS), which is the direct cost of producing the items sold. Calculating profit as a percentage of revenue makes it easier to analyze profitability trends over time and to compare profitability with other companies. The formula for calculating gross profit margin is:

Gross profit margin = (Net sales – COGS) / Net sales x 100%

2.   ### Return on Sales (ROS)/Operating Margin [...] 2.   ### Return on Sales (ROS)/Operating Margin

This metric looks at how much operating profit the company generates from each dollar of sales revenue. It is calculated as operating income, or earnings before interest and taxes (EBIT), divided by net sales revenue. Operating income is the profit a company makes on sales revenue after deducting COGS and operating expenses. ROS is commonly used as a measure of how efficiently the company turns revenue into profit. The formula for return on sales is:

Return on sales = (Earnings before interest and taxes / Net sales) x 100%

3.   ### Net Profit Margin

https://www.newsweek.com/sports/nfl/rams.content: # Rams HC Sean McVay Reacts to Puka Nacua Controversy After TNF Loss. After Nacua's exceptional contribution during the TNF loss, Rams head coach Sean McVay grew frustrated when the postgame press conference turned to multiple questions about Nacua's off-field controversies. During McVay's postgame press conference, a reporter asked him about Nacua's recent tweet, which seemed to aim at the officiating, but the Rams coach said he did not know what was said. Asked about Nacua's livestream controversy, McVay said "he was very apologetic" over it. The Rams coach said he didn't believe Nacua understood the "totality of some of the things" he said or did during that livestream, which also included him criticizing the NFL referees. A reporter asked McVay if he thought Nacua was distracted by this week's controversies, and McVay said he didn't think so, adding, "He went off today.". Despite a season in which the Rams appear to be among Super Bowl favorites, Nacua is likely facing hefty fines following this week's livestream and his recent message on X.

# Latest Project management software trends you need to know

Murali Varadharajan

Written by

This guide outlines the emerging trends in project management software that are redefining how teams operate, collaborate, & deliver results in a fast-paced environment.

## The current scenario

Project management software and project management are two sides of the same coin, playing a pivotal role in meeting the demands of today’s fast-paced, collaborative work environment.

As AI fuels innovation, project management software is evolving to meet changing demands. With remote work, hybrid teams, and shifting workplace dynamics, static plans and top-down methods no longer suffice. Modern project management calls for automation, agility, and smarter collaboration. [...] This guide is all about diving into the latest project management software trends that are redefining the way we work, helping you stay ahead, adapt faster, and unlock new possibilities with the tools you rely on every day.

## Project Management Software Trends Redefining How We Work

### #1 AI-powered project management:

AI is the talk of the town, from playing your favourite show using voice commands to delivering high-impact project output, the wave has hit the project management space as well.

These tools provide data-driven insights, eliminate siloed work, and offer predictive analysis—all in a snap. To reduce manual, repetitive tasks, project management software is leveraging AI to: [...] For instance, project management software like monday.com integrates with 200+ tools, including Gmail, Slack, Outlook, Microsoft Teams, and more, ensuring smooth communication and a seamless flow of information.

## What’s Ahead?

With emerging Project management software trends especially in terms of technology, teams are increasingly looking for ways to scale up, boost productivity, and move from cost reduction to ROI generation.

According to Proofhub, the project management software market is expected to reach USD 15.06 billion by 2032, growing at a CAGR of 18.48% from 2024 to 2032. As this growth continues, it’s essential for teams to ensure their project management software aligns with these trends to avoid setbacks and keep operations on track.

https://www.empyra.com/blog/jira-vs-serv.content:
### Asset management and CMDB

ServiceNow absolutely dominates here. Their Configuration Management Database is industry-leading with comprehensive discovery tools, relationship mapping capabilities, and impact analysis features. It's built to handle millions of configuration items without breaking a sweat.

Jira's asset management capabilities are improving, but remain more basic. While you can track assets and map dependencies, you'll need additional tools or marketplace apps to match ServiceNow's capabilities.

### Automation and AI implementation

Both platforms have embraced automation, but ServiceNow's AI capabilities run deeper. Their Now Platform includes predictive intelligence, virtual agents, and performance analytics that can automate complex processes end-to-end. [...] ### Market positioning of Jira Service Management and ServiceNow

In the ITSM heavyweight championship, ServiceNow and Jira Service Management are both top contenders, but they're fighting in slightly different weight classes.

ServiceNow has planted its flag as the enterprise-grade platform for organizations looking to digitize workflows beyond IT. It's comprehensive, powerful, and priced accordingly. Companies with complex, multi-departmental needs often gravitate toward ServiceNow for its breadth of capabilities. [...] Jira Service Management, Atlassian's offering, has leveraged its development pedigree to position itself as the ideal solution for organizations where IT and development teams need to work in lockstep. It's particularly strong for businesses embracing DevOps and offers more attractive pricing for mid-sized organizations.

The gap between these competitors has narrowed significantly in recent years. ServiceNow has improved its developer-friendly features, while Jira has expanded beyond its IT roots into business service management.

## 3. Key Differences Between Jira Service Management and ServiceNow

A multi-cloud strategy isn’t just a tech decision, it’s a business enabler. It empowers agility, resilience, and innovation at scale. But it requires the right mindset, architecture, and tooling.

Atlassian’s cloud-native ecosystem including Jira, Confluence, Bitbucket, and Opsgenie, offers the visibility, automation, and control needed to succeed in a multi-cloud world.

Ready to make your cloud strategy future-proof?

At Empyra, we specialize in helping enterprises design, implement, and scale multi-cloud environments using Atlassian tools. Whether you’re just exploring or scaling globally, we’re here to guide you every step of the way.  Talk to Our Cloud Experts

Copyright © 2026 Empyra [...] ## 3. Why Adopt a Multi-Cloud Strategy?

A well-designed multi-cloud approach isn’t just about avoiding risk; it’s about actively driving value. Here are some of the key reasons why organizations are going multi-cloud:

### Resilience & High Availability

By running workloads across providers and geographies, businesses reduce the risk of downtime. If one cloud suffers an outage, others remain unaffected, ensuring business continuity.

### Best-of-Breed Capabilities

Each cloud provider offers unique strengths. Azure might offer the best integration with Microsoft tools, AWS may lead in serverless, while GCP shines in data analytics. A multi-cloud strategy lets you cherry-pick the best services for your needs.

### Cost Optimization

### 3. Average Revenue Per Client

This measures the average revenue generated from each client, providing insights into the profitability of your customer base. It's an essential metric for evaluating the health of your client relationships and the effectiveness of your fee models.

Formula: Average Revenue per Client = Total Revenue / Total Number of Clients

### 4. Time Spent On Each Client

This metric measures the amount of time spent managing each client, helping assess resource usage when compared to net profits for each client. It's crucial for optimizing your practice management and ensuring you're allocating time effectively.

### 5. Net Profit Per Client [...] ### 2. Customer Lifetime Value (LTV)

This represents the total expected revenue from a single customer, influenced by your fee structure and AUM minimums. It's a crucial metric for understanding the long-term value of your client relationships.

Formula: LTV = Average Purchase Value × Purchase Frequency × Customer Lifespan

### 3. Marketing Conversion Rate

This percentage shows how many visitors are performing a desired action (e.g., subscribing, scheduling a call). This rate should be tracked across various marketing initiatives to understand which are most effective.

Formula: Conversion Rate = (Number of Conversions / Total Number of Visitors) × 100

### 4. Website Traffic [...] ### 3. Amount Of Recurring Revenue

This represents the total amount of revenue generated from ongoing client relationships. The higher this figure, the better your client and revenue retention. It's a key indicator of the stability and predictability of your practice's income.

### 4. Next-Generation Client Relationship Rate

This percentage shows how many of your clients' next generation (e.g., children or heirs) are also engaged with your firm. It indicates your ability to sustain relationships across generations, which is crucial for long-term practice growth.

Formula: Next-Generation Client Relationship Rate = (Number of Clients with Next-Generation Engagement / Total Number of Clients) × 100

This metric measures the amount of time spent managing each client, helping assess resource usage when compared to net profits for each client. It's crucial for optimizing your practice management and ensuring you're allocating time effectively.

### 5. Net Profit Per Client [...] ### 2. Customer Lifetime Value (LTV)

This represents the total expected revenue from a single customer, influenced by your fee structure and AUM minimums. It's a crucial metric for understanding the long-term value of your client relationships.

Formula: LTV = Average Purchase Value × Purchase Frequency × Customer Lifespan

### 3. Marketing Conversion Rate

This percentage shows how many visitors are performing a desired action (e.g., subscribing, scheduling a call). This rate should be tracked across various marketing initiatives to understand which are most effective.

Formula: Conversion Rate = (Number of Conversions / Total Number of Visitors) × 100

### 4. Website Traffic [...] ### 3. Amount Of Recurring Revenue

This represents the total amount of revenue generated from ongoing client relationships. The higher this figure, the better your client and revenue retention. It's a key indicator of the stability and predictability of your practice's income.

### 4. Next-Generation Client Relationship Rate

This percentage shows how many of your clients' next generation (e.g., children or heirs) are also engaged with your firm. It indicates your ability to sustain relationships across generations, which is crucial for long-term practice growth.

Formula: Next-Generation Client Relationship Rate = (Number of Clients with Next-Generation Engagement / Total Number of Clients) × 100

https://www.netsuite.com/portal/resource.content:
23.   ### Return on Assets (ROA)

This efficiency metric shows how well an operations management team uses its assets to generate profit. It takes into account all assets, including current assets such as accounts receivable and inventory, as well as fixed assets, such as equipment and real estate. ROA excludes interest expense, as financing decisions are typically not within operating managers’ control. The formula for return on assets is:

Return on assets = Net income / Total assets for period

24.   ### Selling, General and Administrative (SG&A) Ratio [...] 1.   ### Gross Profit Margin

This is an intermediate — but critical — measure of the profitability and efficiency of the company’s core business. It’s calculated as gross profit divided by net sales, and is usually expressed as a percentage. Gross profit is net sales minus cost of goods sold (COGS), which is the direct cost of producing the items sold. Calculating profit as a percentage of revenue makes it easier to analyze profitability trends over time and to compare profitability with other companies. The formula for calculating gross profit margin is:

Gross profit margin = (Net sales – COGS) / Net sales x 100%

2.   ### Return on Sales (ROS)/Operating Margin [...] 2.   ### Return on Sales (ROS)/Operating Margin

This metric looks at how much operating profit the company generates from each dollar of sales revenue. It is calculated as operating income, or earnings before interest and taxes (EBIT), divided by net sales revenue. Operating income is the profit a company makes on sales revenue after deducting COGS and operating expenses. ROS is commonly used as a measure of how efficiently the company turns revenue into profit. The formula for return on sales is:

Return on sales = (Earnings before interest and taxes / Net sales) x 100%

3.   ### Net Profit Margin

https://www.newsweek.com/sports/nfl/rams.content: # Rams HC Sean McVay Reacts to Puka Nacua Controversy After TNF Loss. After Nacua's exceptional contribution during the TNF loss, Rams head coach Sean McVay grew frustrated when the postgame press conference turned to multiple questions about Nacua's off-field controversies. During McVay's postgame press conference, a reporter asked him about Nacua's recent tweet, which seemed to aim at the officiating, but the Rams coach said he did not know what was said. Asked about Nacua's livestream controversy, McVay said "he was very apologetic" over it. The Rams coach said he didn't believe Nacua understood the "totality of some of the things" he said or did during that livestream, which also included him criticizing the NFL referees. A reporter asked McVay if he thought Nacua was distracted by this week's controversies, and McVay said he didn't think so, adding, "He went off today.". Despite a season in which the Rams appear to be among Super Bowl favorites, Nacua is likely facing hefty fines following this week's livestream and his recent message on X.

# Latest Project management software trends you need to know

Murali Varadharajan

Written by

This guide outlines the emerging trends in project management software that are redefining how teams operate, collaborate, & deliver results in a fast-paced environment.

## The current scenario

Project management software and project management are two sides of the same coin, playing a pivotal role in meeting the demands of today’s fast-paced, collaborative work environment.

As AI fuels innovation, project management software is evolving to meet changing demands. With remote work, hybrid teams, and shifting workplace dynamics, static plans and top-down methods no longer suffice. Modern project management calls for automation, agility, and smarter collaboration. [...] This guide is all about diving into the latest project management software trends that are redefining the way we work, helping you stay ahead, adapt faster, and unlock new possibilities with the tools you rely on every day.

## Project Management Software Trends Redefining How We Work

### #1 AI-powered project management:

AI is the talk of the town, from playing your favourite show using voice commands to delivering high-impact project output, the wave has hit the project management space as well.

These tools provide data-driven insights, eliminate siloed work, and offer predictive analysis—all in a snap. To reduce manual, repetitive tasks, project management software is leveraging AI to: [...] For instance, project management software like monday.com integrates with 200+ tools, including Gmail, Slack, Outlook, Microsoft Teams, and more, ensuring smooth communication and a seamless flow of information.

## What’s Ahead?

With emerging Project management software trends especially in terms of technology, teams are increasingly looking for ways to scale up, boost productivity, and move from cost reduction to ROI generation.

According to Proofhub, the project management software market is expected to reach USD 15.06 billion by 2032, growing at a CAGR of 18.48% from 2024 to 2032. As this growth continues, it’s essential for teams to ensure their project management software aligns with these trends to avoid setbacks and keep operations on track.

Project management software and project management are two sides of the same coin, playing a pivotal role in meeting the demands of today’s fast-paced, collaborative work environment.

As AI fuels innovation, project management software is evolving to meet changing demands. With remote work, hybrid teams, and shifting workplace dynamics, static plans and top-down methods no longer suffice. Modern project management calls for automation, agility, and smarter collaboration. [...] This guide is all about diving into the latest project management software trends that are redefining the way we work, helping you stay ahead, adapt faster, and unlock new possibilities with the tools you rely on every day.

## Project Management Software Trends Redefining How We Work

### #1 AI-powered project management:

AI is the talk of the town, from playing your favourite show using voice commands to delivering high-impact project output, the wave has hit the project management space as well.

These tools provide data-driven insights, eliminate siloed work, and offer predictive analysis—all in a snap. To reduce manual, repetitive tasks, project management software is leveraging AI to: [...] For instance, project management software like monday.com integrates with 200+ tools, including Gmail, Slack, Outlook, Microsoft Teams, and more, ensuring smooth communication and a seamless flow of information.

## What’s Ahead?

With emerging Project management software trends especially in terms of technology, teams are increasingly looking for ways to scale up, boost productivity, and move from cost reduction to ROI generation.

According to Proofhub, the project management software market is expected to reach USD 15.06 billion by 2032, growing at a CAGR of 18.48% from 2024 to 2032. As this growth continues, it’s essential for teams to ensure their project management software aligns with these trends to avoid setbacks and keep operations on track.

### Asset management and CMDB

ServiceNow absolutely dominates here. Their Configuration Management Database is industry-leading with comprehensive discovery tools, relationship mapping capabilities, and impact analysis features. It's built to handle millions of configuration items without breaking a sweat.

Jira's asset management capabilities are improving, but remain more basic. While you can track assets and map dependencies, you'll need additional tools or marketplace apps to match ServiceNow's capabilities.

### Automation and AI implementation

Both platforms have embraced automation, but ServiceNow's AI capabilities run deeper. Their Now Platform includes predictive intelligence, virtual agents, and performance analytics that can automate complex processes end-to-end. [...] ### Market positioning of Jira Service Management and ServiceNow

In the ITSM heavyweight championship, ServiceNow and Jira Service Management are both top contenders, but they're fighting in slightly different weight classes.

ServiceNow has planted its flag as the enterprise-grade platform for organizations looking to digitize workflows beyond IT. It's comprehensive, powerful, and priced accordingly. Companies with complex, multi-departmental needs often gravitate toward ServiceNow for its breadth of capabilities. [...] Jira Service Management, Atlassian's offering, has leveraged its development pedigree to position itself as the ideal solution for organizations where IT and development teams need to work in lockstep. It's particularly strong for businesses embracing DevOps and offers more attractive pricing for mid-sized organizations.

The gap between these competitors has narrowed significantly in recent years. ServiceNow has improved its developer-friendly features, while Jira has expanded beyond its IT roots into business service management.

A multi-cloud strategy isn’t just a tech decision, it’s a business enabler. It empowers agility, resilience, and innovation at scale. But it requires the right mindset, architecture, and tooling.

Atlassian’s cloud-native ecosystem including Jira, Confluence, Bitbucket, and Opsgenie, offers the visibility, automation, and control needed to succeed in a multi-cloud world.

Ready to make your cloud strategy future-proof?

At Empyra, we specialize in helping enterprises design, implement, and scale multi-cloud environments using Atlassian tools. Whether you’re just exploring or scaling globally, we’re here to guide you every step of the way.  Talk to Our Cloud Experts

Copyright © 2026 Empyra [...] ## 3. Why Adopt a Multi-Cloud Strategy?

A well-designed multi-cloud approach isn’t just about avoiding risk; it’s about actively driving value. Here are some of the key reasons why organizations are going multi-cloud:

### Resilience & High Availability

By running workloads across providers and geographies, businesses reduce the risk of downtime. If one cloud suffers an outage, others remain unaffected, ensuring business continuity.

### Best-of-Breed Capabilities

Each cloud provider offers unique strengths. Azure might offer the best integration with Microsoft tools, AWS may lead in serverless, while GCP shines in data analytics. A multi-cloud strategy lets you cherry-pick the best services for your needs.

### Cost Optimization

values.company_briefing:
Empyra is a software solutions provider that offers highly configurable case management platforms and consulting services for state and local government, higher education, adult education, and other domains.

### Core Product/Service
* Provides a highly configurable Case Management Platform
* Offers low-code/no-code solutions for easy implementation
* Delivers consulting services for strategic and technical advisory
* Specializes in ITSM, Agile, DevOps, and data migration
* Offers seamless Jira–ServiceNow sync for ITSM and DevOps collaboration
* Provides multi-cloud strategy design and implementation using Atlassian tools

### Leadership Team
* No specific leadership team members are listed

### Target Market
* Targets state and local government, higher education, and adult education sectors
* Serves medium and large organizations in various industries
* Confirmed customers include Nissan and Zippo
* Partners with Atlassian, Monday.com, Microsoft, SAP, and Salesforce

### Key Differentiators
* Offers a low-code/no-code approach for easy system configurability
* Provides 24/7 support with a presence on three continents
* Atlassian Platinum Enterprise partner and Monday.com Gold Partner
* Proven expertise in agility coaching and technical advisory

### Business Model
* Pricing details are not specified
* Products and services are distributed globally through partnerships and direct sales channels
